title: Regulation W in Banking: Limits on Bank-Affiliate Transactions - Investopedia
summary:
Regulation W, implemented by the Federal Reserve System (FRS), restricts transactions between banks and affiliates to mitigate risk and manage financial safety.
Regulation W Explained: Key Provisions and Impacts Regulation W implements sections 23A and 23B of the Federal Reserve Act.
Complying with Regulation W was complex, even before the regulatory reforms that were instituted in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis.
Banking regulators now expect greater transparency from banks in complying with Regulation W. Determining Applicability: When Does Regulation W Apply?
Financial institutions that are found to be in violation of Regulation W can be hit with substantial civil penalties.
